Faceless Void Guide

Welcome to my guide for Void, my favorite carry and one of the hardest (if not the hardest) carries of the game. Forgive me if I have some grammar mistakes, English is not my native tongue.
This guide is oriented to lategame carrying, so don't expect to be very useful before 30'.
To start it's nice to get a quelling and a stout, to help you with your lasthitting and to bare some harass. You should aim for the safe lane with some support able to babysit you.
My skillbuild is quite defensive, since farming will be our priority and you can't afford to die when playing carries like Void. To that end, i max backtrack and timewalk first. I normally throw a poing in timelock at lvl 4 for that lucky bash that can net you a kill, but I leave it in one, because it scales with AS and early game, well, you can't attack really fast.
Midas can be bought if you are getting good farm, that means if you can get before 8', if you can't, skip it.
Normally, you'll want to rush your bfury and then finish your treads after that. Now, you have two ways: you can go for MoM or Maelstrom. I go for MoM when there's another right-clicker on the other team. Both are good choices.
As it is pointed the rest of your build is highly situational, since you can get MKB if there's someone with evasion on the other team (PA, Brew, butterfly users); butterfly if there are other DPS carries on the enemy team because evasion stacks with backtrack; etc.
After getting your core, you're ready to engage in team fights and be useful for your team (just don't catch them in your chronosphere!).
Using chronosphere isn't difficult, you gotta proritize their carry, initiators. It's ok if you don't get the entire enemy team in your ult, that's quite unusual unless you have Dark Seer or Magnataur in your team.

Well, have fun pwning people with the faceless one!
